comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: "  HE IS JUST SECRETARY BO Sweeney of Interior Department   Doesn't Even Care for "Mister" WASHINGTON, DC, June 23, 1914" – The New York Times If Bain published this photograph ca. 1910-1915, it may have been in relation to the appointment of Bo Sweeney in 1914 as Assistant Secretary of the Interior. This is a photograph of the former Lillian E. Reeves (1880-1929) who married Bo Sweeney on February 2, 1898. She was the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. W. L. Reeves of Trinidad, Colorado.[1] Bo Sweeney (1862-1917) was a native of Missouri, practiced law and was a state representative (D) in Colorado, before moving to Seattle. He served as an assistant Secretary of the Interior with Secretary Lane from 1914 to 1917. Bo died suddenly of a heart attack in Washington in 1917.  [2] [3] [4] A photo of Assistant Secretary Sweeney is in the Bain / LOC Collection on Flickr:
